poem:
"Demagogue's Dance"

Scandals unseen behind a shield of Odin,
A promise of remigration echoes Odin.
Spy-claims skitter like falling leaves in Berlin,
Yet horns of AfD blow, akin to Odin.
Democracy's weft pulled tight, threads thinning -
Can the centre hold its twine to bind in?
One can only hope truth sings akin to Woden,
Unmasking uncanny dances, exposing hidden.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Scandals fail to knock Germany’s AfD off course before electoral tests Scandals buffeting Germany’s far-right AfD are unlikely to do enough damage to blow the party off course before pivotal elections this year, analysts say, but the votes will offer crucial insights into whether the centre can hold against an anti-democratic onslaught. Embarrassing allegations of spying for China and collusion with Russia, after the bombshell revelation in January of a mass “remigration masterplan” for foreigners". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
